page.title: 12Heathfield Farm, Thurso
page.content: Heathfield has no cows, no bulls and no calves but 80 stirks. The farm is 150 acres. The metal buildings are about 64 years old and the stone buildings are about 150 years old. There are 11 fields and all of them are used for animals but in the sowing time of the year 3 fields are used for hay. They also keep ewes and 113 lambs. They grow 250 tonnes of their foodstuff. The rest they buy from merchants. Feeding time for the animals is 7.30 am and 5.00 pm. In the future they hope to buy more land and build new buildings. They stop diseases infecting their cattle with dosing and treatment. They call the vet for advice and treatment. They have a tractor and the machinery they use are a cultivator and a grass harvester. They get up at 7.00 am and they work for 15 hours.
